rev.comment: Need to call it as it is.
How exciting, my first revert war... I don't belive that the changes actually reflect the talk page consensus.
RV to last version by SlimVirgin, please do not insert this again
revert to last version by Tazmaniacs, which seem to be more in line with views expressed on talk page
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/Tazmaniacs|Tazmaniacs]] ([[User talk:Tazmaniacs|talk]]) to last version by SlimVirgin
one note is enough for an undisputed facts; five is a bit over-doing, not user-friendly, and may be accused of spam-linking
one note is enough for an undisputed facts; five is a bit over-doing, not user-friendly, and may be accused of spam-linking
funds go in "fund" subsection, not in the intro
funds go in "fund" subsection, not in the intro
moved "the group is banned in Jordan" to "other" subsection;
loads of sources for uncontested fact about suicide bombings deleted per talk)
Militant is in no way a weasel word. It is used by all major media to describe the group.
loads of sources for uncontested fact about suicide bombings deleted per talk
militant deleted - on talk page everyone seem to agree it is aweasel word
Nearly every worldwide media describes Hamas as a militant group.
added Avalon Project charter page as ref too
call it as it is. No ephamisms

'Propaganda' carries a strong negative connotation; given the other sources such as U.S. State Department, which admittedly engages in propaganda worldwide, it is POV to ascribe the word to one source
made clear that it is still their charter
My apologies, I accidentally reverted to an earlier version (browser cache) while only attempting to make minor edits. I accidentally re-inserted links which previous editors had reverted.
POV-tag removed, at least the introduction is somehow balanced
sources for non-contested fact about suicide bombings removed
repetition deleted - views on terror stated a few lines later
"militant deleted" - everyone seems to agree that this is a weasel word
Restored fact deleted by anon 81.170.110.252 - please participate in talk first.
/* Other */ rm unsourced comments (which have been unsourced since several months)
some refs which had been lost in time...
rm funds in intro; there is a subsection for this matter

self revert - sorry I wasnt attentive enough
not totally disputed, its clearly not neutral, but it is well documented
"Militant" as a term is worldwide consensus for the group--see any major media
separate source of funding and being listed as terrorist into two sentences. 2 separate ideas->2 sentences
changing tag, since factual inaccuracies are being repeatedly reintroduced
rv misinformation, as explained on talk page
Clarified name as acronym and militancy
revert to better and more accurate version, mention correct Muslim Brotherhood origins, change wikisource link to Avalon project
restored Muslim Brotherhood; it belongs in the intro
rv; we can't use Wikipedia (or source) as a source, because anyone can edit it; and we already say they want to set up an Islamic state
Replace link to bad translation with link to wikisource for covenant, remove unsourced statement and replace with real Hamas position
I rearranged (w/out removing anything) to put more relavent information first, and put unrerlated information in seperate sentances. Word terrorist is now removed, so removed POV tag.
/* January 2006 - Winning the legislative election */ grammar
it is obviously not neutral to label a group as a terror organization, either keep the tag or write a NPOV article
unfortunately it's not a pov, but a world-accepted consensus
you can think its a terror organisation, but stating it is a fact is POV
/* Support among the Palestinian population */ rewording
/* Support among the Palestinian population */ rewording
restored some deleted material, delelted terrorist from the first sentence
It would be ridiculous to make no mention of this in an article about hamas
would you please keep the cool and not use this page for displaying aversions
revert to last version buy Bondegezou
